Description: Pair of straight clappers in form of right and left hand with forearm: the joints of the fingers and thumbs have been marked with three incised groups on the right hand and two in the left; there is a depression between each of the digits, and the ends of the thumbs are separated from the fingers. Eight incised lines on the right wrist and seven on the left represent bracelets. On the right-hand clapper there are three roundel ornaments above the bracelet and twenty-seven on the forearm, while on the left there are two above the bracelet and twenty-one on the forearm. The clappers are straight-ended and pierced with a hole.
